elements.title: COSMOS field (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the COSMOS field (pictured) is the largest contiguous survey of the universe ever taken by the Hubble Space Telescope?

elements.title: Harrogate War Memorial (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Harrogate War Memorial, by Ernest Prestwich, names 1163 casualties of the First and Second World Wars, of whom more than 300 have unknown graves, and the youngest was 15 years old?

elements.title: YouTube Rewind 2018: Everyone Controls Rewind (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that within a week of its upload, YouTube Rewind 2018: Everyone Controls Rewind became YouTube's most-disliked video of all time?

elements.title: 1916 Warsaw City Council election (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that no voting was held in four out of six curiae in the 1916 Warsaw City Council election, as the Polish and Jewish parties had agreed on a single joint candidate slate?

elements.title: Phillip Eng (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority general manager Phillip Eng brews his own beer?

elements.title: a 3rd-century codex (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the oldest complete versions of the Book of Jonah and 1 Peter are from a 3rd-century codex discovered in Egypt in 1952?

elements.title: Andrew Tate (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that social media influencer Andrew Tate described himself as "absolutely a misogynist"?

elements.title: Bajroqi Miⱨnat (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when the Bukharian-Jewish Soviet newspaper Bajroqi Miⱨnat switched to the Latin script, it initially did not use capital letters, following Jewish writing rules?

elements.title: Edna May Sperl (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that actress Edna May Sperl's fiancé was arrested on the day of her wedding by a federal marshal because her fiancé's father opposed the marriage?
